message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with algorithmic problems arising in game theory and mechanism design, which are typically studied in the cs.GT (Game Theory) sub-category. The problem of mixture selection involves optimization over a high-dimensional simplex, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category. The paper presents an approximation algorithm for a function with certain smoothness and stability properties, which are typical concerns in the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. The paper also discusses information theory and communication complexity, which are relevant to the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category. Finally, the paper applies its algorithm to various game-theoretic problems, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category.
